questions.text: "Silent Running" is at base an ecology film and a moral drama. The film features an array of giant greenhouses which hold the last remaining vestiges of nonhuman life from Earth. Why are they there?
questions.correct: All nonhuman life on Earth has been destroyed
options: A dream of a wealthy investor
questions.explanation:
All nonhuman life on Earth has been destroyed.

	The life has been destroyed by nuclear fallout.

questions.text: Who starred in the movie as Freeman Lowell, the scientist whose mission is to care for the plants?
questions.explanation:
Bruce Dern.

	Dern has appeared in many movies; one of the most famous being 'All the Pretty Horses.' His portrayal of the sensitive, mad Freeman Lowell is ranked by many as one of his best.

questions.text: This movie takes place aboard the spacecraft 'Valley Forge', one of a number of crafts which hold the greenhouses. Where were these scenes filmed?
options: In a botanical garden in Los Angeles
questions.explanation:
Aboard an aircraft carrier.

	The aircraft carrier was actually named 'Valley Forge.' It had been decommissioned. It was repainted and refurbished for the filming, and was scrapped when the filming was done.

questions.text: The 26-foot model of the Valley Forge used in special-effects shots was made from, among other things, 650 what?
questions.explanation:
Army tank model sets.

	In these pre-"Star Wars" days, such a set was quite impressive.

questions.text: The droids in this movie have been seen as forerunners of R2-D2. Although they start as mindless drones, Lowell programs the droids to play cards, perform surgery, and tend to the plants. What were the names of the trio of droids?
questions.explanation:
Huey, Dewey and Louie.

	Louie is lost fairly early in the film after falling from the outside of the ship while trying to repair it.

questions.text: What was unusual about the actors who played the droids, controlling them from inside?
questions.explanation:
They were amputees.

	Four different actors worked inside the droids.

questions.text: In the movie, the forest begins to wither and die, and Lowell researches the cause. What did Lowell find was killing his plants?
questions.explanation:
Lack of sunlight.

	It has been so long since plants grew on Earth that their need for sunlight is not common knowledge.

questions.text: What orders do Lowell and his companions receive from Earth?
options: Meet an alien civilization and show them the forests
Take the forests to Mars for colonization
questions.explanation:
Destroy the forests.

	This is the crux of the movie. Lowell cannot destroy what he loves, and sets out to save the last forest as the others are being blown up around him.

questions.text: Why does Lowell kill his three shipmates?
questions.correct: They are planning to destroy the forests
options: They are killing the animals in the dome for fun
questions.explanation:
They are planning to destroy the forests.

	Lowell's shipmates are following the orders to destroy the forests. After killing them, Lowell reprograms the ship to head into deep space.

questions.text: Why is this movie called 'Silent Running'?
options: Because the forests are so quiet
Because Lowell doesn't speak in the movie
questions.explanation:
Because the ship becomes silent.

	From the 'Silent Running' home page-'Badly injured, he blasts his ship into a lonely orbit in which, he hopes, he will never be found, whilst sending distress signals claiming a ghastly mishap causing massive explosions on board have killed the other crew members. Cutting the engines, drifting into deep space, Lowell silences all radio communications from the ship, going into what submariners term 'silent running'. '

questions.text: Who is the final caretaker of the forests?
questions.explanation:
Dewey.

	I won't give too much away if you haven't seen the movie- but the ultimate scene of Dewey tending to the forests is guaranteed to inspire some strong emotions.

questions.text: This movie features a wonderful classical score as well as two songs, one of them called 'Silent Running.' Who wrote and sang the poignant 'Rejoice In The Sun', which featured lyrics such as 'Tell them it's not too late. Cultivate, one by one. Tell them to harvest and rejoice, in the sun'?
questions.explanation:
Joan Baez.

	Baez also sang several other songs for this film.

questions.text: One of the movie's writers went on to a career of fame in writing TV dramas, including 'Hill Street Blues' and 'L.A. Law.' Who is he?
questions.explanation:
Steven Bochco.

	"Silent Running" is an early indication of his strong script-writing abilities.

questions.text: Three writers worked on this movie. The same trio of writers produced one other Oscar-winning film. What was it?
questions.explanation:
The Deer Hunter.

	The writers were Steven Bochco, Michael Cimini and Deric Washburn.

questions.text: This film was directed by Douglas Trumbull, who learned special effects from Stanley Kubrick while working on '2001: A Space Odyssey.' What is another film on which Trumbull was responsible for special effects?
questions.correct: Close Encounters of the Third Kind
questions.explanation:
Close Encounters of the Third Kind.

	He also worked on "Star Trek", "BladeRunner" and many others.
